notesStmt.note: Innermost margin yellowish, possibly from lying against roller.
Outer end darkened by mould and dirt, continuing at edges.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 11; ruled lines: 39; written lines: 39; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible stiching of membranes. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ. The letter ע in the last word slightly flourished. A few majuscular or minuscular letters. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 11 lines, in accordance with the rule. Wooden roller (587mm high).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 16th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum from Rev. Thos. Butler on 05 July 1841: inscribed on verso.
